header_summary:
The development team at WizardSardine has made strides in implementing an encryption scheme for Liana wallet descriptors, inspired by Salvatore Ingala's work on DelvingBitcoin. With draft implementations and a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) now available for community review, this initiative highlights significant advancements in securing Bitcoin wallet descriptors through cryptographic enhancements. The scheme's development, including proposed deterministic nonce generation and cryptographic choices, underscores ongoing discussions within the developer community about optimizing security and functionality ([GitHub](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1951), [DelvingBitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/a-simple-backup-scheme-for-wallet-accounts)).

Christopher Allen and others have been instrumental in integrating FROST with Bitcoin technology, particularly for its Distributed Key Generation (DKG) capabilities, which bolster security by decentralizing private key storage. This integration, supported by resources like demonstrations and code walkthroughs, facilitates understanding and adoption of FROST for signing Bitcoin transactions, marking a significant step in enhancing Bitcoin's security landscape ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8csdApREJIs), [Blockchain Commons' GitHub sponsors page](https://github.com/sponsors/BlockchainCommons)).

The release of Bitcoin Core version v29.1rc2 by fanquake presents a minor yet crucial update in the Bitcoin Core software suite, emphasizing the importance of community involvement in testing and feedback. This release candidate, available for review and testing, signifies the collective effort in refining Bitcoin Core, ensuring its reliability and efficiency for users and developers alike ([Bitcoin Core](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.1/test.rc2/)).

Cedarctic's exploration of a stealthier variant of BGP hijacking underscores significant vulnerabilities within the Bitcoin network, highlighting the practical feasibility of eclipse attacks. This research suggests potent mitigation strategies, including leveraging networking data and incorporating traceroute capabilities into Bitcoin Core, to enhance the network's security against sophisticated interception attacks, thereby improving the resilience of Bitcoin's peer-to-peer network against external threats ([DelvingBitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/eclipsing-bitcoin-nodes-with-bgp-interception-attacks/1965)).

recent_posts.title: [BIP Draft] Bitcoin Encrypted Backup
recent_posts.summary:
- WizardSardine's development team has progressed on an encryption scheme for Liana wallet descriptors.
- A draft Bitcoin Improvement Proposal and implementations are now open for community feedback.
- Discussions focus on cryptographic choices like nonce generation, cipher selection, and encoding strategies.

recent_posts.title: FROST CLI + BDK CLI Demo
recent_posts.summary:
- FROST enhances Bitcoin security with Schnorr signatures and DKG, lacking prior integration.
- Demonstrations and resources aim to educate developers on FROST's application in Bitcoin transactions.
- Support from various entities has propelled FROST's development, offering involvement opportunities.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 29.1 release candidate 2 available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version v29.1rc2 binaries are now available for testing.
- The source code is accessible on GitHub, with preliminary release notes provided.
- This release encourages community feedback to enhance software reliability before the official release.

recent_posts.title: Eclipsing Bitcoin Nodes with BGP Interception Attacks
recent_posts.summary:
- Exploring a stealthier BGP hijacking reveals vulnerabilities, enabling eclipse attacks on Bitcoin's network.
- Proof-of-concept shows practicality of hijacking Bitcoin traffic, leveraging BGP communities for stealth.
- Proposed mitigations include rotating peers and using RPKI-protected prefixes to enhance network security.

recent_posts.title: Delving Simplicity Part Ⅲ: Building Data Types
recent_posts.summary:
- Simplicity, a blockchain programming language, facilitates complex computations with its unique type system.
- The language efficiently handles logical and arithmetic operations, demonstrating flexibility in data manipulation.
- It evolves to support secure, efficient smart contracts, indicating substantial capacity for blockchain applications.

recent_posts.title: Confidential Script: Emulate soft forks using stateless TEEs
recent_posts.summary:
- A public crate with specific opcodes is created for integration into the Inquisition repository.
- There is a request for @ajtowns to consider adding kernel support to Inquisition.
- The project aims to develop a secure, user-friendly system facilitating independent transaction exits.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Add BIP-0093 (Codex32) as application to BIP-0085
active_posts.summary:
- Ben Westgate proposes integrating BIP-0093 with BIP-0085 for secure wallet backups.
- Codex32, part of BIP-93, aims to improve seed backups with features like error correction.
- The integration seeks to standardize and enhance the creation of codex32 backups from BIP-85.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] OP_TWEAKADD
active_posts.summary:
- Jeremy shared a draft BIP proposing OP_TWEAKADD to enhance Bitcoin scripting.
- The proposal prioritizes push semantics for succinct on-chain operations.
- It seeks community feedback for potential refinement and future enhancements.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Elliptic Curve Operations for Bitcoin Script
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal aims to enhance Bitcoin scripting with new Elliptic Curve op codes.
- It introduces op codes for advanced functions, broadening smart contract possibilities.
- A reference implementation for `btcd` and the full BIP text are available online.

active_posts.title: A simple backup scheme for wallet accounts
active_posts.summary:
- Josh's method is defined by unique inscription and location features.
- It suggests standardizing Salvatore's method before adding Josh's unique aspects.
- The strategy aims to combine both methods for a comprehensive solution.

active_posts.title: CVE-2024-38365 public disclosure (btcd `FindAndDelete` bug)
active_posts.summary:
- Niklas Gögge and Antoine Poinsot identified a critical flaw in Btcd software versions before 0.24.2.
- Their findings revealed a deviation in legacy signature verification, potentially enabling node forking.
- A coordinated effort, including CVE identification and a bug bounty, led to the issue's resolution by version 0.24.2.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin and Quantum Computing
active_posts.summary:
- The collaboration produced a report on quantum computing's impact on Bitcoin.
- The report evaluates threats to Bitcoin's security from quantum computing advancements.
- It suggests upgrading cryptographic algorithms to enhance Bitcoin's quantum resistance.

today_in_history_posts.title: Completing the retirement of the alert system
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The Bitcoin alert system was removed due to problems and scalability issues.
- It posed a risk of misuse and the private key was compromised.
- A final alert will be sent before publicly disclosing the key to prevent misuse.

today_in_history_posts.title: Testing a Flare-like routing implementation on 2500 AWS nodes
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Flare is a modified routing protocol for the Lightning Network tested by Pierre's team.
- The implementation focused on onion-encrypted, inter-node communication over existing channels.
- Testing revealed a high route-finding success rate, though directional assumptions and a bug impacted results.

today_in_history_posts.title: Hardcoded seeds, DNS seeds and Darknet nodes
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The study shows how darknet nodes connect to Bitcoin without DNS, using hardcoded seed data.
- A proof-of-concept seeder for darknet addresses aims to improve Bitcoin network integration.
- Community feedback is vital for enhancing this seeder, with research into DNS `NULL` queries ongoing.
